activities.place_details: Sikhism's holiest gurdwara; gold-plated sanctum, parikrama and langar (community kitchen).
activities.best_time_to_visit: Early morning or evening (for the palki ceremony)

activities.place_details: Public garden and memorial of the 1919 massacre; museum and gallery.
Flag-lowering ceremony at India–Pakistan border; patriotic event in the evening.
activities.ticket_pricing: Transport + viewing stands (~₹200-₹800 depending on transport & seat)

activities.place_details: Dedicated museum on 1947 Partition history; curated exhibits and oral histories.
Hindu temple built in a style resembling the Golden Temple; sacred lake & architecture.
Historic market for textiles, phulkaris, juttis and Punjabi goods.
Museum in the summer palace complex with artefacts, armory and paintings.
Heritage educational institution with colonial-era architecture and grounds.

activities.place_name: Takhats & Religious sites (Rambagh, Tarn Taran nearby)
activities.place_details: Important Sikh religious centers and gurdwaras near Amritsar (day trips).
Try Amritsari kulcha, chole, lassi and street sweets near old city.

Amritsar.climate: Subtropical with hot summers (Apr–Jun), monsoon (Jul–Sep), pleasant winters (Nov–Feb). Best: Oct–Mar.
Amritsar.foods: Amritsari kulcha, chole, lassi, Punjabi kebabs, makki di roti sarson da saag.
Amritsar.travel_tips: Respect gurdwara etiquette (cover head, remove shoes); carry water in summer; book Wagah transport in advance for peak days.
Amritsar.local_transport: Cycle-rickshaws, auto-rickshaws, taxis, app taxis, local buses.

activities.place_details: Unique sculpture garden made from industrial & urban waste by artist Nek Chand.
Man-made reservoir with promenades, boating and sunrise views.
Asia's largest rose garden with thousands of varieties and annual rose festival.
Museum with Gandharan sculptures, Pahari & Rajasthani miniature paintings.

activities.place_name: Capitol Complex (Le Corbusier buildings) - exterior view
activities.place_details: UNESCO-listed modernist civic architecture — Secretariat, Assembly and High Court.
activities.ticket_pricing: Free for exterior view; guided tours may be limited

activities.place_details: Central commercial hub for shopping and eating.
Peaceful themed gardens good for photography and relaxation.
Try tandoori delights, chole bhature and Punjabi sweets.
Mughal-style terraced gardens near Panchkula with fountains and heritage buildings.
Local shopping and cafes with modern Punjabi lifestyle ambience.

Chandigarh.climate: Subtropical; hot summers, mild winters; best: Oct–Mar.
Chandigarh.foods: Punjabi cuisine, chole bhature, tandoori rotis, lassi.
Chandigarh.travel_tips: Chandigarh is walkable and well-planned; use auto-rickshaws and taxis; carry light wool in winter evenings.
Chandigarh.local_transport: Auto-rickshaws, taxis, local buses, app taxis; bicycles in some sectors.

activities.place_details: Small museum and green spaces showing regional agriculture history.
Industrial city known for hosiery and bicycle manufacturing; markets for local goods.
Large public park with jogging trails and small local sights.
Historic Mughal-era site with a small gurudwara and memorials, near Ferozepur road.

Ludhiana.climate: Hot summers, cool winters; best: Oct–Mar.
Ludhiana.foods: Punjabi staples, tandoori items, sweets and street snacks.
Ludhiana.travel_tips: Ludhiana is industrial — plan market visits; carry ID in markets; use local taxis/rickshaws.

activities.place_details: Modern corporate & leisure hub with restaurants, nightlife and events.
Parks by day, bustling eateries and pubs by night.
Large entertainment complex with live musicals, cultural shows and food gully.
activities.ticket_pricing: Show tickets ₹499-₹1999; culture gully food extra

activities.place_details: Automobile & transport heritage museum (day trip).
Important wetland for migratory birds in winter months; good for birdwatching.
Modern malls and local markets for shopping & dining.

Gurgaon (Gurugram).climate: Subtropical; hot summers and cool winters; best: Oct–Mar.
Gurgaon (Gurugram).foods: North Indian, Punjabi, modern fusion; many restaurants in Cyber Hub.
Gurgaon (Gurugram).travel_tips: Gurgaon is spread out — plan transport; app taxis are convenient; avoid peak office hours for traffic.
Gurgaon (Gurugram).local_transport: App taxis, local buses, autos (limited), metro (Yellow Line connection to Delhi).

activities.place_details: Sacred tanks tied to Mahabharata lore; religious ceremonies and evening aarti.
Museum and displays on the Mahabharata and archaeology.
Pilgrimage spots with mythic associations; good for cultural exploration.
Try local North Indian cuisine and sweet shops.

Kurukshetra.climate: Subtropical; hot summers, cool winters. Best: Oct–Mar.
Kurukshetra.foods: North Indian, Punjabi specialties and local sweets.
Kurukshetra.travel_tips: Kurukshetra is a religious circuit — respect local customs; best visited during festivals for cultural events.

activities.place_details: Granary built in 1786 with panoramic views of Patna & Ganges.

activities.place_name: Patna Sahib Gurudwara (Takht Sri Patna Sahib)
activities.place_details: One of Sikhism's five takhts; birthplace of Guru Gobind Singh.
Archaeological finds, artifacts and Buddhist antiquities from Bihar.
Open ground used for events; nearby markets for shopping.
Ancient seat of learning; ruins of Nalanda University (UNESCO tentative list), ~90 km from Patna.

activities.place_name: Rajgir (day trip) - Vulture’s Peak & hot springs
activities.place_details: Buddhist and Jain pilgrimage sites; scenic hills and ropeways.

Patna.climate: Humid subtropical; hot summers, cool winters; best: Oct–Mar.
Patna.foods: Litti-chokha (Bihar specialty), sattu-based foods, local sweets.
Patna.travel_tips: Nalanda/Rajgir day trips require private transport or guided tours; respect religious rules at pilgrimage sites.
Patna.local_transport: Auto-rickshaws, cycle-rickshaws, taxis, buses; trains to nearby historical sites.

activities.place_details: UNESCO World Heritage Site; Bodhi Tree where Buddha attained enlightenment; major Buddhist pilgrimage site.
Sacred fig tree area with silent meditation and shrine rooms.
Various international monastic complexes offering meditation programs and cultural exhibits.
Museums and smaller temples with artefacts related to Buddhism.

Bodh Gaya.climate: Humid subtropical; best: Oct–Mar (pleasant); summers can be hot.
Bodh Gaya.foods: Local Bihari fare and international vegetarian cuisines around monasteries.
Bodh Gaya.travel_tips: Respect monastery rules (silence, footwear); many hotels cater to pilgrims with simple vegetarian meals.
Bodh Gaya.local_transport: Autos, cycle-rickshaws, hired cars for day trips.

activities.place_details: Ruins of ancient Nalanda University with stupas, monasteries and archaeological museum.
Artifacts and sculptures from excavations at Nalanda.
Nearby hills with Buddhist & Jain sites and ropeway access.

Nalanda (town).travel_tips: Combine Nalanda with Bodh Gaya & Rajgir on a multi-day cultural loop.
Nalanda (town).local_transport: Hired cars, local buses, cycle-rickshaws in towns.

activities.place_details: Major Shakti shrine on Nilachal Hill; festival of Ambubachi attracts pilgrims.
Small island temple in the Brahmaputra reached by ferry; scenic views.
Collection of ethnographic, archaeological and historical artefacts.
Bustling local market for Assamese handicrafts, silk and food.
High-density one-horned rhinoceros reserve; jeep or elephant safari available.
activities.ticket_pricing: Safari fees (~₹500-₹2000 depending on vehicle & guide)

activities.place_details: Urban park with music events and sculptures.

Guwahati.climate: Humid subtropical; heavy monsoon Jun–Sep; best: Oct–Apr.
Guwahati.foods: Assamese thali, fish dishes, pitha, local tea.
Guwahati.travel_tips: Monsoon can disrupt travel; try Assam tea experiences; book wildlife safaris in advance.

activities.place_details: UNESCO World Heritage site; one-horned rhinoceros, elephants, tigers; jeep & elephant safaris.
activities.ticket_pricing: Park entry + safari fees (~₹1000-₹5000 depending on safari & foreigner fees)
activities.time_travel_each_location: Half-day per safari (two safaris recommended: morning & afternoon)

activities.place_details: Exhibits of regional orchids and plants.
Cultural visits showcasing Assamese rural life and tea estates near Kaziranga.

Kaziranga (near Bogor or Kohora base).climate: Subtropical with heavy monsoon; park closed in peak monsoon. Best: Nov–Apr.
Kaziranga (near Bogor or Kohora base).foods: Rice-based meals, fish curry, local Assamese specialties.
Kaziranga (near Bogor or Kohora base).travel_tips: Book safaris and accommodation early for peak season; respect park rules; guided safaris only.
Kaziranga (near Bogor or Kohora base).local_transport: Jeep safaris, hired cars, local buses to Kohora; limited public transport inside park buffer.

activities.place_details: Ruins and monuments from the Ahom kingdom including palaces, tanks (sagar) and temples.
activities.ticket_pricing: Small entry fees at some sites

activities.place_details: One of the tallest Shiva temples in Assam with religious significance.

Sivasagar.climate: Subtropical; monsoon heavy Jun–Sep; best: Oct–Mar.
Sivasagar.foods: Assamese cuisine, rice specialties, fish dishes.
Sivasagar.travel_tips: Combine Sivasagar with Majuli/Kaziranga if time allows; local guides helpful for Ahom history.

activities.place_details: Iconic 16th-century landmark and central market (Laad Bazaar for bangles).
Historic mosque near Charminar; large congregational mosque.
Massive hill fort with sound-and-light shows and panoramic views.
Royal necropolis with domed tombs and gardens.
Palace complex of the Nizams with ornate halls and collections.
One of India's largest museums with diverse global artefacts.
Lake with Buddha statue, boating and evening promenades.
Old City market famous for bangles, pearls and traditional wear.
Large film studio complex with themed attractions and shows (~1 hr from city).
Try authentic biryani, haleem (seasonal), and kebabs.

Hyderabad.climate: Semi-arid; hot summers, mild winters; best: Oct–Feb.
Hyderabad.foods: Hyderabadi biryani, haleem (Ramadan), kebabs, Irani chai.
Hyderabad.travel_tips: Traffic can be heavy — plan travel time; use app taxis; try early morning for Golconda or Ramoji.
Hyderabad.local_transport: Metro (Hyderabad Metro), buses, auto-rickshaws, taxis, app taxis.

activities.place_details: Ruined fort complex and masonry remains of Kakatiya architecture.
Kakatiya-period temple with intricate pillars and sculptures.
Hilltop temple and scenic lake good for evenings.
Famous for Pochampally sarees and ikat weaving (day trip).

Warangal.climate: Tropical; hot summers, mild winters. Best: Oct–Feb.
Warangal.foods: Telangana cuisine, spicy curries, local biryani variants.
Warangal.travel_tips: Combine Warangal with a Pochampally textile tour; hire a car for rural day trips.
Warangal.local_transport: Autos, taxis, buses; hired cars for nearby villages.

activities.place_details: Fort on the Manair River with historic ruins and scenic views.
Large reservoir with boating and picnic spots.

Karimnagar.travel_tips: Karimnagar is a good base for rural Telangana experiences; hire private transport for ease.

activities.place_details: Natural cave formation with stream flowing through; popular picnic spot.
Tiered waterfall and therapeutic sulphur springs; light trekking nearby.
Heritage building with botanical gardens and museums.
Cave temple dedicated to Shiva with water dripping onto the shivalinga.
Hill station with Mall Road, Kempty Falls, Gun Hill; ~1-1.5 hrs drive from Dehradun.

Dehradun.climate: Hill climate; mild summers, cold winters; best: Mar–Jun & Sep–Nov (for clear vistas).
Dehradun.foods: North Indian, Kumaoni specialities, local sweets.
Dehradun.travel_tips: Dehradun is a gateway — use it for hill station day trips; book Mussoorie travel early on weekends.
Dehradun.local_transport: Taxis, buses, shared cabs for Mussoorie; auto-rickshaws locally.

activities.place_details: Picturesque lake at Nainital town center with boating and lakeside promenade.
Temple near the lake and popular Mall Road for shopping & eateries.
Scenic viewpoint accessible by short trek/horse ride with Himalayan panoramas.
Cable car up to a vantage point for panoramic snowy peaks views.

Nainital.climate: Mountain climate; cool summers, cold winters with snowfall in Dec–Feb. Best: Mar–Jun & Sep–Nov.
Nainital.foods: Kumaoni dishes, local sweets, street food on Mall Road.
Nainital.travel_tips: Avoid peak monsoon for slippery trails; book lakeside hotels early in season; carry warm clothes in winters.
Nainital.local_transport: Taxis, shared jeeps, walking in town, ropeway/cable car to viewpoints.

activities.place_details: Famous ghat for daily Ganga aarti; highly spiritual and crowded at dusk.
Hindu temple on hilltop reachable by ropeway for panoramic views.

Haridwar.climate: Subtropical to hill climate; best: Feb–Apr & Sep–Nov.
Haridwar.foods: Simple North Indian vegetarian fare; local sweets and prasad.
Haridwar.travel_tips: Respect temple rules; expect crowds during festivals; stay in clean accommodation close to ghats for early morning rituals.
Haridwar.local_transport: Autos, cycle-rickshaws, taxis, buses; ropeway for hill temples.

activities.place_details: Hill with views of Ranchi, associated with Rabindranath Tagore's stay.
Scenic landscaped garden with waterfalls and sculptures.
Waterfall and picnic spot near Ranchi with seasonal flow.

Ranchi.climate: Subtropical with pleasant winters; best: Oct–Mar.
Ranchi.foods: Local Jharkhand fare and tribal cuisine influences.
Ranchi.travel_tips: Ranchi is a gateway to waterfalls and hills; hire local transport for day trips.
Ranchi.local_transport: Taxis, autos, buses; hired cars for excursions.

activities.place_details: Well-maintained public park with floral displays, fountains and small lake.
Reservoir & recreational area for boating and picnics.

Jamshedpur.foods: Local Bihari & Jharkhand specialities; straightforward North Indian cuisine.
Jamshedpur.travel_tips: Jamshedpur is an industrial city with good green spaces; hire local transport for best access.

Mumbai.climate: Humid coastal climate. Best months: Nov–Feb. Heavy rain June–Aug.
Mumbai.foods: Vada pav, pav bhaji, seafood, kebabs, Mumbai-style biryani, misal pav.
Mumbai.travel_tips: Avoid peak-hour traffic; book Elephanta ferry early; Marine Drive best at sunset.
Mumbai.local_transport: Local trains, metro, BEST buses, taxis, autos, Uber/Ola.

activities.place_details: Iconic 20th-century monument overlooking the Arabian Sea.
Street shopping lane with cafés and local markets.
UNESCO-listed Gothic architecture railway terminus.
3.6 km promenade known as Queen's Necklace.
Historic mosque located on an offshore islet.
Museum dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi.
Rock-cut cave temples dedicated to Lord Shiva; UNESCO site.
Art galleries, streets, historic buildings.

Pune.climate: Pleasant year-round; heavy monsoon. Best: Oct–Feb.
Pune.foods: Misal pav, vada pav, bhakarwadi, Maharashtrian thali.
Pune.travel_tips: Hill stations (Lonavala, Lavasa) are great day trips. Traffic mild compared to Mumbai.
Pune.local_transport: Autos, PMT buses, metro, taxis, bikes.

activities.place_details: 18th-century Maratha fort palace.
Historic building where Gandhi was imprisoned.

Nashik.foods: Misal, thalipeeth, grapes, local Maharashtrian dishes.

activities.place_details: India's pioneering winery experience.

Bengaluru.foods: Dosa, idli, filter coffee, chaat, biryani.
Bengaluru.travel_tips: Traffic heavy; plan visits early morning.

activities.place_details: Historic garden with rare plants & lake.

Mysuru.foods: Mysore pak, dosa, idli, vangi bath.

activities.place_details: Royal palace illuminated on Sundays.

Hampi.travel_tips: Carry water — large ruins to walk.

activities.place_details: Ancient temple in Hampi Bazaar.

Jaipur.climate: Hot summers, cool winters; Best: Oct–Mar.
Jaipur.foods: Dal baati churma, ghevar, mirchi vada.

activities.place_details: Hill fortress, Sheesh Mahal.
Lakefront royal palace.
Gandhi’s residence and peaceful museum.

Vadodara.travel_tips: Laxmi Vilas Palace is a must-visit.

activities.place_details: Grand royal residence.

Chennai.climate: Hot & humid coastal weather; best time: Nov–Feb.
Chennai.foods: Idli, dosa, filter coffee, Chettinad chicken, seafood.
Chennai.travel_tips: City traffic heavy; beaches best during sunrise; temples require modest clothing.
Chennai.local_transport: Metro, suburban trains, autos, taxis, buses.

activities.place_details: One of the longest beaches in the world with local food stalls.
Classic Dravidian-style temple dedicated to Lord Shiva.
Built over the tomb of St. Thomas the Apostle.
Historic British-era fort now housing a museum and state assembly.
Wide collection of archaeology, sculpture, bronze works.
UNESCO monuments including Shore Temple, Arjuna’s Penance, Pancha Rathas.

Coimbatore.climate: Pleasant year-round; warm summers. Best: Nov–Feb.
Coimbatore.foods: Idli, dosa, ghee roast, kongu cuisine.
Coimbatore.travel_tips: Perfect gateway to Ooty & Valparai hill stations.

activities.place_details: Hilltop Murugan temple with scenic views.
Museum of wildlife, forestry, taxidermy.

Madurai.climate: Very hot summers, mild winters. Best: Nov–Feb.
Madurai.travel_tips: Temples crowded during festivals; follow dress code.

activities.place_details: Historic Dravidian architecture temple complex.
17th-century palace with stunning Indo-Saracenic style.

Kochi.climate: Humid tropical; heavy monsoon Jun–Sep; best: Oct–Feb.
Kochi.foods: Appam & stew, Kerala parotta, seafood, puttu.
Kochi.travel_tips: Fort Kochi ideal for walking; ferry is cheap & scenic.

activities.place_details: Historic seaside town with old churches & nets.
Historical museum featuring Kerala murals.

Munnar.climate: Cool hill station climate; best: Oct–Mar.
Munnar.travel_tips: Tea estates best at sunrise; early morning for Eravikulam Park.

activities.place_details: Home to Nilgiri Tahr; rolling grasslands.
Tea processing history & tasting.
Famous Kerala backwater ride with meals on board.

Kolkata.foods: Rasgulla, mishti doi, fish curry, rolls.
Kolkata.travel_tips: Trams great for slow touring; Victoria Memorial best at dusk.

activities.place_details: Iconic white marble monument with museum.
Historic cantilever bridge over Hooghly.

Darjeeling.climate: Cool; winter cold. Best: Mar–May & Oct–Dec.
Darjeeling.travel_tips: Tiger Hill sunrise must; book toy train early.

activities.place_details: Himalayan sunrise viewpoint.
Toy train loop with gardens & viewpoints.

Bhubaneswar.travel_tips: Temple dress code modest; combine with Puri & Konark.

activities.place_details: 11th-century Shiva temple; strict entry rules.
Ancient Jain caves & carvings.

Puri.travel_tips: Jagannath Temple crowd heavy; beaches safe near lifeguard areas.

activities.place_details: Major Hindu pilgrimage site; famous Rath Yatra.
Golden sand beach with local vendors.

Agra.climate: Hot summers, pleasant winters. Best months: Oct–Feb.
Agra.travel_tips: Taj Mahal closed on Fridays; reach early morning for best photos.

activities.place_details: UNESCO site; iconic white marble mausoleum.
Massive red-sandstone fort with palaces & Mughal architecture.
Garden across Yamuna offering Taj sunset view.
Mughal tomb considered precursor to Taj Mahal.

Varanasi.climate: Hot summers, cool winters; best: Nov–Feb.
Varanasi.travel_tips: Assi Ghat & Dashashwamedh Ghat are best for aarti.

activities.place_details: Major Shiva temple; high security.
Main ghat known for grand Ganga Aarti.

Lucknow.travel_tips: Old city great for heritage walk.

activities.place_details: Historic complex with labyrinth (Bhul Bhulaiya).

Bhopal.climate: Hot summers; pleasant winters; monsoon moderate.
Bhopal.travel_tips: Bhopal is lake city — evenings best near Upper Lake.

activities.place_details: Major lake with boating activities.
Interactive museum celebrating tribal culture.

Indore.climate: Dry summers; cool winters; best: Oct–Feb.
Indore.foods: Poha, jalebi, Indori namkeen, street food at Sarafa.
Indore.travel_tips: Sarafa Bazaar open late night for food.

activities.place_details: Seven-storey historical palace.
Famous late-night street food lane.

Khajuraho.travel_tips: Light & sound show at western group temples recommended.

activities.place_details: UNESCO heritage temples with sculptures.

Visakhapatnam.travel_tips: Rushikonda & RK Beach best during sunrise.

activities.place_details: Popular beach with museums around.
Hilltop viewpoint with ropeway.

Tirupati.travel_tips: Book darshan tickets early; huge crowds on weekends.

activities.place_details: India's busiest pilgrimage spot.

Shimla.climate: Cool; snowfall in winter. Best: Mar–Jun & Oct–Dec.
Shimla.travel_tips: Mall Road is pedestrian-only; parking limited.

activities.place_details: Main shopping & walking street.
Hilltop temple with giant Hanuman statue.

Manali.climate: Cold; snow winters; best: Mar–Jun & Oct–Dec.

activities.place_details: Cedar-forest temple dedicated to Hidimba Devi.
Shopping street with cafés & shops.

Dharamshala.climate: Pleasant; cold winters. Best: Mar–Jun & Oct–Nov.
Dharamshala.travel_tips: McLeod Ganj best for cafés & monasteries.

activities.place_details: Tibetan monastery & spiritual center.
Short trek to scenic waterfall.

Srinagar.climate: Cool temperate; pleasant summers (Apr–Jun), cold winters with snow (Dec–Feb). Best: Apr–Oct for Kashmir valley.
Srinagar.foods: Rogan josh, yakhni, gushtaba, kahwa, Kashmiri breads and sweets.
Srinagar.travel_tips: Carry warm clothes from Oct–Mar; respect local customs; book houseboats/permits in advance during peak season.
Srinagar.local_transport: Taxis, shared cabs, shikara (on Dal Lake), local buses.

activities.place_details: Iconic lake with houseboats, floating gardens and shikara (boat) rides; perfect for sunrise/sunset.
Carefully terraced Persian-style gardens built by Mughal rulers with scenic views.
Hilltop temple with panoramic views of Srinagar and Dal Lake.

activities.place_name: Old Srinagar & Lal Chowk (shopping & local food)
activities.place_details: Historic markets for pashmina, spices, saffron and Kashmiri street food.
Hill station famous for gondola, skiing (winter) and wildflowers in summer; Gondola is one of highest cable cars.
activities.ticket_pricing: Gondola phases paid (~₹700–₹2500 depending on phase & season)
activities.time_travel_each_location: Full day (2–3 hours travel one way incl. activities)

activities.place_details: Scenic valley, starting point for Amarnath Yatra; trekking, river views and pine forests.
activities.time_travel_each_location: Full day trip (3–4 hours travel each way)

activities.place_details: Important Muslim shrine and nearby terraced garden (Pari Mahal) with views of Dal Lake.
activities.ticket_pricing: Free (donations optional); Pari Mahal small fee

Jammu.climate: Subtropical to temperate; hot summers in plains, winter cold in hills. Best: Mar–Oct for Jammu region.
Jammu.foods: Kulcha, rajma, Dogra cuisine, local sweets.
Jammu.travel_tips: Jammu is gateway to Vaishno Devi pilgrimage — plan transport & darshan in advance during peak season.

activities.place_details: Major Hindu temple complex in Jammu city; bustling markets nearby.
Historic fort overlooking Tawi river with nearby garden and small museum.
Royal complex with museum of Dogra heritage and art.
One of India’s major pilgrimages — trek to holy cave of Vaishno Devi from Katra (~12 km uphill trek or helicopter options).
activities.best_time_to_visit: All year (avoid heavy snowfall in winter passes)

activities.place_details: Explore local food, sweets and handicrafts of Jammu region.
Hill resorts near Jammu with trekking, paragliding (Sanasar) and scenic views (Patnitop).

Pahalgam.climate: Cool mountain climate; best Apr–Oct for sightseeing; heavy snow in winters.
Pahalgam.foods: Kashmiri preparations, local trout in season.
Pahalgam.travel_tips: Great for trekking, river rafting, and base for Amarnath pilgrims; carry warm clothes and hiking gear.

activities.place_details: Scenic valley with river and meadows; popular for Bollywood shoots and walks.
Meadows and trekking start point with scenic views and pony rides.

Leh.climate: High-altitude cold desert; short warm summer (Jun–Sep); long harsh winter (Oct–Apr). Best: Jun–Sep (roads open).
Leh.foods: Thukpa, momos, tsampa (local barley), butter tea.
Leh.travel_tips: Acclimatise in Leh for 1–2 days; stay hydrated; avoid strenuous activity first day; permits required for some areas.
Leh.local_transport: Taxis, shared cabs, motorbikes (hire), local buses (limited).

activities.place_details: Historic royal palace with views and small museums; market for local crafts.
White-domed stupa with panoramic views over Leh, popular at sunrise/sunset.
Cold desert valley; sand dunes at Hunder, camel rides (Bactrian camels) and Diskit Monastery.
activities.ticket_pricing: Transport & stays (₹1000–₹5000 depending on vehicle & lodging)

activities.place_details: High-altitude lake famous for changing colours; location used in films; border area with permits.
activities.ticket_pricing: Transport & permit costs (₹2000+ for transport depending on season)

activities.place_details: Important Buddhist monasteries with festivals (Hemis festival) and impressive architecture.

activities.place_name: Tso Moriri (alternative high-altitude lake, multi-day trip)
activities.place_details: Remote lake with wildlife; quieter than Pangong but requires longer drive.

Nubra (Diskit).climate: High-altitude desert; warm days, cold nights in summer; heavy snow/ blocked roads in winter. Best: Jun–Sep.
Nubra (Diskit).foods: Simple Ladakhi/ Tibetan fare — thukpa, momos, local barley dishes.
Nubra (Diskit).travel_tips: Khardung La road can be bumpy; acclimatize before long drives; carry cash in remote areas.
Nubra (Diskit).local_transport: Shared jeeps, taxis, local homestays provide transport.

activities.place_details: Large statue of Maitreya Buddha with views of Nubra valley.

activities.place_name: Hunder Sand Dunes & Bactrian Camel Ride
activities.place_details: Cold desert dunes offering double-humped camel rides and scenic sunsets.

Shillong.climate: Subtropical highland; heavy monsoon (Jun–Sep). Best months: Oct–May (avoid heavy rains).
Shillong.foods: Jadoh (rice & meat), dohneiiong, local bamboo shoot dishes.
Shillong.travel_tips: Roads can be affected by landslides in monsoon; hire local drivers for remote spots.

activities.place_details: Pleasant lake in the city and main shopping/food street.
Scenic waterfall and highest viewpoint near Shillong for panoramic views.
Ethnographic museum showcasing NE tribal cultures.
World-famous waterfalls and living root bridges in the region; extremely high rainfall area.

Cherrapunji (Sohra).climate: Extremely high rainfall (world's wettest regions); best Oct–May.
Cherrapunji (Sohra).foods: Local Khasi specialities, rice, fish, stews.
Cherrapunji (Sohra).travel_tips: Expect wet conditions; waterproof boots and rain gear essential in monsoon.

activities.place_details: One of India’s tallest plunge waterfalls with dramatic cliff views.

activities.place_name: Mawsmai Cave & Seven Sisters Falls viewpoint
activities.place_details: Limestone cave with short walks; viewpoints for multiple waterfalls.

Mawlynnong.foods: Simple Khasi meals and local produce.
Mawlynnong.travel_tips: Known as Asia’s cleanest village — support local homestays and follow eco-rules.
Mawlynnong.local_transport: Taxis from Shillong; walking within village.

activities.place_details: Natural root bridges grown over decades; requires short treks to view.
activities.time_travel_each_location: Half-day to full day depending on trek

Gangtok.climate: Himalayan; cool temperate; best: Mar–May & Sep–Nov; winter cold & occasional snow at higher altitudes.
Gangtok.foods: Gundruk, thukpa, momos, local Sikkimese & Nepali dishes.
Gangtok.travel_tips: Permits required for some excursions; acclimatize and avoid strenuous treks first day.
Gangtok.local_transport: Taxis, shared jeeps, buses; ropeways in some areas.

activities.place_details: Main pedestrian thoroughfare with shops and cafes; Flower Exhibition features orchids & alpine species.

activities.place_name: Tsomgo (Changu) Lake & Baba Harbhajan Temple (day trip)
activities.place_details: High-altitude glacial lake with bright colours and nearby shrine; permits required.
Important Tibetan Buddhist monastery with impressive architecture and relics.

activities.place_name: Namchi & Char Dham (day trip) or Temi Tea Garden
activities.place_details: Pilgrimage complex with replicas of Char Dham and scenic tea gardens (Temi).

activities.place_name: Hiking or short trek (e.g., Tinjurey or nearby trails)
activities.place_details: Short Himalayan treks for panoramic views and birdwatching.

Pelling.climate: Cool mountain climate; best: Mar–May & Sep–Nov.
Pelling.foods: Local Sikkimese & Nepali foods, momos, thukpa.
Pelling.travel_tips: Great base for Kanchenjunga views; early mornings best for clear views.

activities.place_details: Historic monastery and ruins of former Sikkimese capital with scenic views.

Namchi.climate: Moderate mountain climate; best: Mar–May & Sep–Nov.
Namchi.foods: Local tea garden produce, Nepali cuisine.
Namchi.travel_tips: Char Dham complex offers pilgrimage-style sightseeing without travel across India.

activities.place_details: Replica pilgrimage complex with large idols and scenic viewpoints.

North Goa.climate: Tropical; best time Nov–Feb; monsoon Jun–Sep.
North Goa.foods: Goan fish curry, vindaloo, bebinca, prawns, xacuti.
North Goa.travel_tips: Scooter rentals are best; beaches crowded in Dec–Jan; water sports at Baga & Calangute.

activities.place_details: Famous beach known for nightlife, shacks, water sports.
Largest beach in Goa with lots of activities.
17th-century Portuguese fort overlooking the Arabian Sea.
Clean beach ideal for relaxing and walking.

South Goa.foods: Fish thali, chicken xacuti, Goan sweets.
South Goa.travel_tips: South Goa best for peaceful beaches; fewer water sports.

activities.place_details: Long white-sand beach ideal for sunrise walks.
Clean and quiet beach with dolphin watching tours.
One of India’s most beautiful beaches; calm waters and beach huts.
Quiet, pristine beach ideal for meditation and relaxation.

New Delhi.climate: Extreme — very hot summers, very cold winters. Best: Oct–Mar.
New Delhi.foods: Chole bhature, kebabs, parathas, street food at Chandni Chowk.
New Delhi.travel_tips: Use metro for fast travel; markets crowded on weekends.

activities.place_details: War memorial with beautiful lawns.
Official residence of India's President.
Tallest brick minaret in the world; UNESCO site.
Baháʼí House of Worship known for its lotus-shaped architecture.

Old Delhi.foods: Jalebi, parathas at Paranthe Wali Gali, Mughlai food.
Old Delhi.travel_tips: Very crowded; best explored with local guide; beware of pickpockets.

activities.place_details: Massive fort complex built by Shah Jahan; UNESCO site.
Oldest and busiest market famous for food, fabrics, jewelry.

Port Blair.climate: Tropical; best time Oct–Apr; monsoon May–Sep.
Port Blair.travel_tips: Ferries between islands may be delayed during monsoon.

activities.place_details: Historic colonial prison with light & sound show.
Popular palm-fringed beach near the city.

Havelock Island (Swaraj Dweep).travel_tips: Book ferries early; scuba diving & beaches are top attractions.

activities.place_details: One of Asia’s best beaches — white sand & blue waters.
Famous for coral reefs and water activities.

Pondicherry City.foods: French pastries, seafood, South Indian dishes.
Pondicherry City.travel_tips: White Town great for walking; cafes are popular.

activities.place_details: Rocky beach perfect for sunrise walks.
Spiritual center founded by Sri Aurobindo.
Experimental township with iconic golden Matrimandir dome.

Tawang.climate: Cold mountain climate; heavy snow in winter. Best: Mar–Jun & Sep–Nov.
Tawang.foods: Thukpa, momos, Zan (local millet food), butter tea.
Tawang.travel_tips: Permits required (ILP for Indians); roads mountainous; altitude sickness possible.
Tawang.local_transport: Taxis, shared jeeps, local tour jeeps.

activities.place_details: Largest monastery in India; 17th-century Buddhist complex.
Birthplace of the 6th Dalai Lama.
High-altitude Himalayan pass with a turquoise lake.

Ziro.climate: Pleasant summers; cold winters. Best: Mar–May & Sep–Nov.
Ziro.foods: Bamboo shoots, pork dishes, Apatani cuisine.
Ziro.travel_tips: Famous for Ziro Music Festival every September.

activities.place_details: Biodiverse reserve with rare plants & wildlife.

Itanagar.travel_tips: ILP required; roads may be affected in monsoon.

activities.place_details: Historic fort built with stone blocks.

Imphal.travel_tips: Avoid late night travel; women's market (Ima Keithel) is unique.

activities.place_details: Floating phumdis lake; world’s only floating national park.
Floating wildlife reserve; home to Sangai deer.

Moreh.foods: Bamboo shoot dishes, Manipuri rice meals.
Moreh.travel_tips: Border market with Myanmar; check travel advisories.

activities.place_details: Famous border gate for photos & small cross-border trade.

Kohima.foods: Smoked pork, bamboo shoots, axone dishes.
Kohima.travel_tips: Hornbill Festival (Dec) is peak tourism season.

activities.place_details: WWII cemetery honoring soldiers who fought in Kohima battle.
Main venue of Hornbill Festival; showcases Naga culture.

Dimapur.foods: Street food, bamboo shoot pork, rice meals.
Dimapur.travel_tips: Gateway city for Nagaland; good for markets.

activities.place_details: Three-tier waterfall located in Seithekema village.

Agartala.foods: Mui Borok (Tripuri food), fish stews, bamboo shoot dishes.

activities.place_details: Royal palace museum with beautiful gardens.
One of India’s 51 Shakti Peethas.
Ancient 7th–9th century rock reliefs; known as ‘Angkor Wat of the East’.

Aizawl.climate: Pleasant climate; best to visit Oct–April.
Aizawl.foods: Bamboo shoot fry, smoked pork, bai (stew), Mizo dal.
Aizawl.travel_tips: City sleeps early; Sundays everything closed; respect local customs.

activities.place_details: Iconic white stone church surrounded by scenic hills; major landmark of Mizoram.
Popular viewpoint offering panoramic views of Aizawl valley.

Lunglei.climate: Cooler and greener region; best Sept–April.
Lunglei.foods: Mizo cuisines including smoked pork & rice dishes.
Lunglei.travel_tips: Ideal for nature lovers; carry cash as ATM availability may be low.

activities.place_details: Scenic viewpoint overlooking dense green hills.

Chandigarh City.climate: Extreme summers & cold winters; best Feb–April & Sept–Nov.
Chandigarh City.foods: Punjabi cuisine, kulchas, butter chicken, lassi.
Chandigarh City.travel_tips: Sector-based city — easy navigation; auto meters usually work.

activities.place_details: Unique garden made from industrial & household waste materials.
Man-made lake ideal for boating, jogging & sunsets.
Largest rose garden in Asia with seasonal blooms.

Kavaratti.foods: Seafood curries, coconut milk dishes, tuna specialities.
Kavaratti.travel_tips: Entry permit required; flights & ships limited; ideal for water sports.

activities.place_details: Crystal-clear waters ideal for swimming, snorkeling.
Displays coral species, marine history & local culture.

Agatti Island.travel_tips: Has the only airport in Lakshadweep; permits mandatory.

activities.place_details: Turquoise water beach perfect for coral spotting.

Daman.travel_tips: Cheap alcohol; good beaches; crowded on weekends.

activities.place_details: Popular beach ideal for family outings.
Portuguese fort located by the river.

Diu.travel_tips: Less crowded alternative to Goa; great beaches.

activities.place_details: Beautiful crescent-shaped beach with water sports.
Massive Portuguese fort with stunning sea views.
